12001.name: The Judging Booth
12001.description:
The area opens in the midst of a small room with windows on the east and
south walls. These windows provide a complete view of the competition
fields. There are several scorecards, pencils and other items that are
used by the judges sitting on a table. The only exit is a trapdoor
leading down. The air is still and musty. Shadows gather in the corners.

down.description: There is a rickety ladder leading down.

north.description: You see an exit north.

12002.name: Caesar's Private Box
12002.description:
This is the best view in the house! Visible is gladiators fighting or
the chariot races with an unobstructed view. The seats are upholstered
in red velvet and are in top-notch condition. There is a rickety ladder
leading up and a marble staircase leading down. The air is still and
musty. The ceiling hangs low overhead.

up.description: You see a rickety ladder with a trapdoor leading up.

down.description: There is a marble staircase leading down.

12003.name: The West Side Of The Commoner's Seating Area
12003.description:
This is the western side commoner's seating area. There are row upon row
of rough wooden benches bolted to the floor. There is stadium garbage
everywhere and the smell makes you want to puke. Stairs lead up to
Caesar's private box, a small ramp leads down to the playing field and a
hallway leads south. The cobblestones are worn smooth by countless feet.
Vendors and pedestrians bustle past.

south.description: You see a small hallway that leads to a larger area.

12004.name: The Southern Commoner's Seats
12004.description:
This is the southeastern part of the common seating areas. The benches
here are made of stone and are probably centuries old. A few scratches
on one of the benches catch your eye. An acrid smell is coming from the
east and a tunnel leads off to the north. The smell of smoke and
humanity hangs in the air. The cobblestones are worn smooth by countless
feet.

north.description: The tunnel looks like it leads to another seating area.

east.description: There is an acrid smell coming from that direction.

12005.name: The Abandoned Gate
12005.description:
This used to be a gateway to and from western Rome. There is an iron
gate blocking your way and judging by the amount of rust and foliage
growing on the bars, it hasn't been open for years. Looking through the
gate at the barren landscape that lies beyond, Visible is why. A dirt
road leads off to the east, and a store is directly south. The sounds of
city life echo around. Vendors and pedestrians bustle past.

east.description: Through the clouds of dust, you can make out a passable road.

south.description: You can barely make out a storefront through the foliage.

12006.name: Swords 'R  Us
12006.description:
Welcome to the weaponshop of Titus Andronicus!! Rare halberds, whips,
swords and other instruments of death are proudly displayed on the walls
and in gleaming glass cases. More common weapons are stacked like wood
on the floor. To the north you can barely make out a gate. There is a
very secure looking door to the south. Shadows gather in the corners.
The walls are rough-hewn and cold to the touch.

north.description: You can see a city gate to the north.

south.description: There is a very secure looking door blocking your progress.

12007.name: The Back Room
12007.description:
If you thought that there were a lot of weapons in the front of the
store, you haven't seen anything yet!! There is barely enough room to
walk amongst the crates of armor and swords. No wonder Rome will stand
for a thousand years. The only exit is through a door to the north. The
walls are rough-hewn and cold to the touch. Dust motes drift in the
stale air.

north.description: Through the piles of weapons, you can see a door leading north to the rest of  the store.

extra_descs: weapons swords crates armor weapon sword crate

12008.name: Peanut Heaven
12008.description:
The area is now so high up that you begin to feel lightheaded and your
nose feels like it is going to start bleeding. There aren't even benches
to sit on here; just bare dirty stone. The view of the surrounding
country is spectacular. Unfortunately you can barely see the playing
field. There is a set of steps here, leading down. The sounds of city
life echo around. The cobblestones are worn smooth by countless feet.

12009.name: The Practice And Warm-up Area
12009.description:
There are many gladiators, chariot drivers and their coaches here,
warming up in preparation for the games. The dust rising from the
parched earth makes you want to sneeze. A short tunnel leads east and
the thunder of pounding hooves and the clash of weapons can be heard
coming from the south. Tall grass sways in a gentle breeze. The air is
fresh and clean.

east.description: There is a large oval dirt-track in that direction.

south.description: You can hear the clash of weapons and the thunder of hooves in that direction.

12010.name: The Jousting Arena
12010.description:
This is a wide open grassy plane... LOOK OUT!!!! The area is almost
skewered by a gladiator's lance as he makes his charge. A practicing
area is due north. The air is fresh and clean. Tall grass sways in a
gentle breeze.

north.description: Through a small tunnel you can see athletes stretching and warming up for the games.

up.description: You see a set of steps leading up into the spectator stands.

12012.name: A Dirt Road
12012.description:
The area is a parched and dusty rural road which runs east and west.
There is a structure lying to the south. Tall grass sways in a gentle
breeze. The air is fresh and clean.

east.description: Through the dust, you see a paved road.

south.description: It is difficult to see through the haze and dust.

west.description: It is difficult to see through the haze and dust.

12013.name: The Commoner's House
12013.description:
This is the main living quarters of a common Roman citizen. The
furnishings are sparse and it is warm here. A putrid odor is coming from
the east and passages lead north and south. Shadows gather in the
corners. The air is still and musty.

north.description: A dusty road lies to the north.

east.description: What is that smell??!!!  It is enough to make a yak gag!!!

south.description: You hazard a guess that a bedroom lies in that direction.

12014.name: The Bedchamber
12014.description:
This is the bedroom. There is a hard and lumpy bed in the far corner. It
looks like the commoner's wife has been shirking her duties lately, as
there is a big pile of soiled laundry here. The only way out is from
where you came. The air is still and musty. The walls are rough-hewn and
cold to the touch.

north.description: You see the living quarters to the north.

12015.name: The Noblemans' Box
12015.description:
These are the 'better' seats used primarily by the upper class of Rome.
There is a large seating area to the east and a staircase leading up
here. The view of the chariot track is pretty good. The walls are rough-
hewn and cold to the touch. The ceiling hangs low overhead.

east.description: Rows upon rows of bleachers lie to the east.

12016.name: The Race Track
12016.description:
This is a hard dirt track about a quarter of a mile long. There are hoof
prints everywhere, and you see a large cloud of dust approaching. You
had better move before get run over. A small tunnel leads west, you
can see the crowd to the east. You can hear loud snarls and roars coming
from below. The ground is soft underfoot. The air is fresh and clean.

west.description: You see athletes warming up and stretching.

down.description: Do you like lots of live lions that haven't been fed for a few days?

12017.name: The Lion Pit
12017.description:
As you land at the bottom of this dirt-walled pit, the realization that
a pit full of lions is NOT a good thing to be hanging around in. Several
of the gladiators gather around the edge of the pit to watch your
demise. You look around, and all you see is tawny fur and gaping
jaws... it is too late to run, too late to hide. Twelve lions rip you
and your belongings into a gory mass of bloodied leather, bronze, and
bone. What's that old saying? Cats killed the curious? Something like
that, I'm sure... The ceiling hangs low overhead. The walls are rough-
hewn and cold to the touch.

12018.name: The South Entrance To The Coliseum
12018.description:
The area opens at the south entrance to the Coliseum. There are citizens
of Rome everywhere, apparently in a mad rush to get in. A statue of
Caligula the Mad Emperor overlooks the area. There are long lines
standing to the east, and an acrid smell is coming from the west. A busy
road lies to the south. The cobblestones are worn smooth by countless
feet. Vendors and pedestrians bustle past.

east.description: The lines are very long and people look impatient.

south.description: A road lies in that direction.

west.description: An acrid, almost medicinal smell is coming from that direction.

12019.name: The Main Highway
12019.description:
This is a well built and heavily traveled road running from east to west
and there is a large structure built entirely of stone to the north. The
sounds of city life echo around. Vendors and pedestrians bustle
past.

north.description: You can hear the roar of a large crowd of people coming from that direction.

east.description: The highway continues to the east.

west.description: The highway continues to the west.

12020.name: The Outhouse
12020.description:
PEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEE-YEEEEEWWWWWWWW!!!!! Boy does it stink in here!!! You
taste bile in your mouth and your eyes begin to water. As you wipe away
your tears, you see that this is a small room, in the far corner of
which a hole is dug. The odor intensifies as you move closer and there
is a roll of toilet paper sitting on the ground. The only exit is to the
west and your nose and stomach are strongly suggesting that you use it.
The air is still and musty. The walls are rough-hewn and cold to the
touch.

west.description: The living quarters lie in that direction.  Why don't you stop pussyfooting  around and go that way??!!  Please?

12021.name: The Slave Quarters
12021.description:
This is where the slaves sleep. There are hard boards set out for use as
beds and not much else. The only exit is to the east. The ceiling hangs
low overhead. Shadows gather in the corners.

east.description: To the east, a well manicured path winds through the nobleman's estate.

12022.name: The Common Seating
12022.description:
This is where many of the common Roman citizens are seated during the
games. These are the cheapest seats in the house, as glare from the sun
is usually a problem during the afternoon. Like the other common seating
areas, this place could stand extensive renovation and a thorough
cleaning. This area extends to the south and a much more elegant seating
area can be seen to the west. The smell of smoke and humanity hangs in
the air. The cobblestones are worn smooth by countless feet.

west.description: The seating gets much fancier and elegant in that direction.

south.description: The common seating area continues.

12023.name: The Common Seating
12023.description:
This is where many of the common Roman citizens are seated during the
games. Like the other commoners' areas in the coliseum, it could use
extensive renovation and cleaning. This area extends to the north and
lots of noise can be heard coming from the south. The cobblestones are
worn smooth by countless feet. Vendors and pedestrians bustle past.

north.description: The common seating area continues.

south.description: You see hundreds, perhaps thousands of people.

12024.name: The East Entrance To The Coliseum
12024.description:
The area opens at the east entrance to the Coliseum. There are people
everywhere, apparently in a mad rush to get in. A statue of Tiberius, an
Emperor of a time long since passed, stands here looking out over the
crowd. There is a passage to the north, the ticket booth is to the south
and a gate opening to the city lies to the east. The cobblestones are
worn smooth by countless feet. The smell of smoke and humanity hangs in
the air.

north.description: You see rows upon rows of dilapidated wooden bleachers.

south.description: There are VERY long lines standing outside the ticket booth.

east.description: Nero Drive lies in that direction.

12025.name: The Ticket Booth
12025.description:
Long lines are standing here, waiting to buy tickets. There are three
vendors working furiously. Ticket stubs litter the ground and you can
see that the people are getting very impatient. There is a large, open
cashbox here. Main entrances to the Coliseum are to the north and west.
The air is still and musty. Dust motes drift in the stale air.

north.description: You see hundreds, if not thousands of people.

west.description: You see hundreds, if not thousands of people.

12026.name: A Paved Road
12026.description:
The area is a paved road that runs east to west. Visible is an elaborate
looking estate to the south and to the north-west, off in the distance,
Visible is a very large stone structure. Buildings crowd together on all
sides. The sounds of city life echo around.

east.description: The road leads off to the east.

south.description: It looks like a Nobleman's estate.  We are talking RICH nobleman's estate.

west.description: The road leads west towards the highway.

12027.name: A Noble Estate
12027.description:
The area is the grounds of a nobleman's estate which is hundreds of
times the size and splendor of anything that a common citizen of Rome
would ever hope to own. Everything is lush and green. The grass is
perfectly manicured and the trees are all bearing fruit. Ornamental
plants are in perfectly situated to enhance and adorn the three statues
of dedicated to gods Jupiter, Venus and Neptune. A tranquil path leads
east and west, there is a paved road to the north and an extravagant
house lies to the south. Wildflowers dot the landscape. Tall grass sways
in a gentle breeze.

north.description: You see a paved road in the distance.

east.description: The path leads east through the estate.

south.description: You see an incredible house off in the distance.

west.description: Off through the trees, you see a small, plain hut.

extra_descs: trees tree shrubs shrub plants plant

12028.name: An Opulent House
12028.description:
The area opens in a house, the size and splendor of which almost defies
the imagination. The floor is done with hand crafted marble tile with
silver and jeweled inlays. The light coming through the exquisitely
crafted stained glass windows bathes the room in splendor and the
furniture looks as though it was made by master craftsmen from all over
the empire. A path through the estate is north of here. The walls are
rough- hewn and cold to the touch. The air is still and musty.

north.description: You see a well manicured path that winds through the estate.

12029.name: The Great North Gate
12029.description:
This is the northern gateway to the city of Rome. The huge gate appears
to be closed and locked against intrusion. A large road muddy road runs
through the gate and into the countryside. Nero Drive runs south from
here. The sounds of city life echo around. The smell of smoke and
humanity hangs in the air.

south.description: Nero Drive continues in that direction.

12030.name: Nero Drive
12030.description:
A path runs through a paved road that runs south through the city of
Rome. A great gate is directly north of here. The Roman citizens are
very friendly and tip their hats or say hello as you pass. The sounds of
city life echo around. The smell of smoke and humanity hangs in the air.

north.description: To the north, you can see a gate leading out of the city.

south.description: Nero Drive continues in that direction.

west.description: You see the bakery of Rome.

12031.name: Nero Drive
12031.description:
A path runs through a great paved road that runs north and south through
the city. People are hurrying from one place to another, but always stop
to say hello. Most of the people are either coming from or going to the
town square. Nero Drive continues to the north, and Visible is a large
open area to the south. The sounds of city life echo around. Vendors and
pedestrians bustle past.

north.description: Nero drive continues in that direction.

south.description: It looks like the town square.

west.description: You see the an opulent estate.

12032.name: The Town Square
12032.description:
This is the middle of a large open area which is the common area of
Rome. During the day, this place is alive with the hustle and bustle of
all of the citizens of Rome and everyone in the city is sure to stop by
at some time or another. There are several street vendors peddling their
wares and the overall atmosphere is carnival-like in nature. To the
southeast, off in the distance, Visible is the aqueduct and the
buildings of the Roman government lie to the northwest. Nero Drive leads
north and south from here and Clay Avenue runs east. Buildings crowd
together on all sides. The smell of smoke and humanity hangs in the air.

north.description: Nero Drive heads in the direction of the northern gate.

south.description: A street made of hard packed clay runs in that direction towards the aqueduct and buildings of the Roman government.

east.description: Nero Drive heads in the direction of the south gate.

12033.name: Nero Drive
12033.description:
A path runs through a paved road that runs north and south through the
city of Rome. There are many people here, as polite as always. Most of
them are either coming from or going to the town square which lies to
the north. Nero Drive continues to the south. There is an observation
area overlooking the aqueduct to the east and a paved road leads west.
The cobblestones are worn smooth by countless feet. The sounds of city
life echo around.

north.description: The town square lies in that direction.

east.description: The aqueduct and mountain of the gods are in that direction.

south.description: Nero Drive continues toward the South Gate.

west.description: A paved road runs west through the city.

12034.name: Nero Drive
12034.description:
This is a busy paved road that runs north through the city. The people
of Rome are very friendly and say hello as you pass. A gate leading out
of the city lies to the south and a small path goes west towards a
nobleman's estate. To the east, off in the distance, lies the great
mountain. It is rumored that the Gods watch over and protect the empire
from there. The cobblestones are worn smooth by countless feet. The
sounds of city life echo around.

north.description: Nero Drive leads in that direction.

south.description: You see many people entering and leaving the city through a large gate in the walls protecting the city.

west.description: It looks like a nobleman's estate.  We are talking RICH nobleman's estate.

12035.name: The South Gate
12035.description:
This is the southern gateway to the city of Rome. The bronze gate is
closed and locked. Looking through the bars, you see a heavily traveled
road leading out of the city. Nero Drive starts here and runs north and
a wizard's shop lies to the east. The smell of smoke and humanity hangs
in the air. The cobblestones are worn smooth by countless feet.

north.description: Nero Drive leads towards the center of town.

east.description: A small store, from which an occasional detonation can be heard, lies off in that direction.  It appears to be surrounded by a rolling pink mist.

12036.name: The Emperor's Private Office
12036.description:
This is the Emperor's private office. The room is richly furnished with
the finest of the loot brought back from conquests of far away lands.
There is a massive, intricately carved desk here, upon which are
important documents, decrees and other paperwork involved in running the
empire. On the far wall, there is a marble bookcase that is well stocked
with the works of Homer, Plato, Socrates and other wise men. Further, it
seems that the current Emperor likes flowers as there are many potted
and cut specimens throughout the room. There is a french door leading to
the waiting room and a wooden door to the south. Shadows gather in the
corners. The walls are rough-hewn and cold to the touch.

east.description: Through the door, you see a waiting room.

south.description: The south door leads directly to the senate chambers.

12037.name: The Senate Chambers
12037.description:
This is the working room where elected senators from all over the empire
gather to advise the Emperor. An official seal of the Emperor is hanging
on the far wall. There is a wooden door to the north and a bronze door
to the east and doublehung door to the south. The walls are rough-hewn
and cold to the touch. The air is still and musty.

north.description: The door is made of thick walnut.

east.description: The door leads to the foyer.

12038.name: The House Of Commons
12038.description:
This is the lower house of the advising body to the Emperor. Common men
from all parts of Rome work here to further assist the senators in
advising the Emperor on critical matters of state. The seal of the
Emperor is painted on the far wall. The only exit is to the north. Dust
motes drift in the stale air. The ceiling hangs low overhead.

north.description: You see that the doublehung door leads to the senate chambers.

12039.name: Clay Avenue
12039.description:
The area is a wide well traveled road running east and west through the
heart of Rome. There are large crowds of people to the west and the road
continues to the east. The aqueduct is directly south of here. The
cobblestones are worn smooth by countless feet. The sounds of city life
echo around.

east.description: Clay Avenue continues in that direction.

south.description: You see an entrance to the aqueduct.

west.description: There are large crowds of people in that direction.

12040.name: The Observation Lookout
12040.description:
The area is a platform overlooking a massive aqueduct. There is a
telescope mounted to the railing that surrounds the area and you can
hear the gurgle of water as it is channeled into the city. Off in the
distance, Visible is the Mountain of the Gods. There is a sign mounted
to the railing and a ramp leads west. The sounds of city life echo
around. Vendors and pedestrians bustle past.

west.description: You can see a busy street in that direction.

12042.name: The Mage's Shop
12042.description:
This is the mage's shop. Magical ointments, charms and potions are
sitting on shelves and behind a glass counter. There is a dense neon
blue fog hugging the floor here, making it impossible to see below your
knees. You suddenly hear mutterings coming from the back room, possibly
from...
KKKKKAAAAAABBBBOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMM!!!!!!
The area is deafened by the noise from a tremendous explosion and the
concussion from the blast staggers you! The shopkeeper seems to pay no
heed to this. The door to the back room opens and an older man, wearing
a pointed hat, whose face is smudged with soot sticks his head out. 'Is
everyone alright? Sorry about that. I was testing a new spell. I'll try
to give advance notice next time.', he says. The door then closes. The
air is still and musty. The walls are rough-hewn and cold to the touch.

east.description: The door is reinforced with steel and looks VERY sturdy.  Considering the 'test' that you just witnessed, you are glad that it stands between you and whatever is going on in the back room.

west.description: You see the south gate through the door.

12043.name: The Waiting Room
12043.description:
This is a very large room with a high ceiling and there are a few people
waiting here to see the Emperor on urgent matters. The master scheduler
tells you to have a seat and sends a page to inform the his highness of
your arrival. There are large doors to the east and west and an exit
leads south to the foyer. The ceiling hangs low overhead. Shadows gather
in the corners.

east.description: There is a sign on the door that says:  MUNICIPAL COURT OF ROME.  It appears  to be open.

south.description: The foyer is directly to the south.

west.description: There is a large door to the west.

12044.name: The Entrance Foyer
12044.description:
You have just entered the main government building of the Roman Empire
and are standing in a massive room with an elaborately decorated domed
roof. There are many people here; messengers and senators being the most
numerous. There is a large, ornate door to the west, a hallway leads
north and marble stairs that lead out of the building are to the south.
The air is still and musty. The ceiling hangs low overhead.

north.description: You see a hallway leading north to what looks like a waiting room.

west.description: There is a large door to the west that blocks your path.

down.description: You see a stairway leading out of the building.

12045.name: Outside The Capitol Building
12045.description:
The area opens on white marble steps that lead up and into the Capitol
Building. There are several statues, none of any real significance, at
the entrance to the building. The main entrance to the building is at
the top of the steps. Vendors and pedestrians bustle past. The
cobblestones are worn smooth by countless feet.

up.description: The steps lead into the Capitol Building.

down.description: The steps terminate onto Clay Avenue.

12046.name: Clay Avenue
12046.description:
This area is a wide, heavily traveled road that runs east and west
through the heart of the city. There are marble steps leading up. To the
south, off in the distance, Visible is a large stone structure and a
mountain that is partially obscured by the haze. There is a general
store to the north. The sounds of city life echo around. The smell of
smoke and humanity hangs in the air.

north.description: The general store lies in that direction.

east.description: There is what appears to be a large gate in that direction.

west.description: Clay Avenue continues.

up.description: There are some white marble steps leading up.

12047.name: The Summit Of The Mountain Of The Gods
12047.description:
This is the summit of a very high mountain and are standing above the
clouds. The sun is shining brilliantly here and the clouds below look
like balls of cotton. The path that you have been walking on is damp and
the scent of lilac is in the air. The air is thin and cold at this
altitude. The wind howls around exposed peaks.

down.description: You see a damp path leading back down the mountain.

12049.name: Froboz's Workshop
12049.description:
This is the workshop of Froboz the Great, the most powerful and famous
mage that Rome has ever known. Workbenches line the walls and are
covered with various test tubes, beakers, petri dishes and crucibles and
there is an odor in here that can best be described as a combination of
old sweat socks and burning tires. The only exit is back through the
door through which you came. In the middle of the room, you see a pile
of ashes that looks like it once was a body and Froboz is is busy making
adjustments on a new type of magic wand... possibly the one responsible
for the explosion a few minutes ago. He removes a jeweler's loupe from
his eye as he turns around. 'How in the name of Merlin did you get in
here??!!' he asks. 'Oh, nevermind! Since you are here, you can serve as
witnesses to the final test of the new mages' spell: "ectowatt".' With
this he makes a magical gesture and a paladin appears. Crossing his
fingers, Froboz waves the wand his direction and what happens next is
incredible! The Paladin is enveloped in what appears to be a small, well
contained, thermonuclear explosion. When the smoke clears Visible is
that the paladin and all of equipment has been reduced to a large pile
of flaming cinders. Froboz throws his head back and cackles with insane
glee. 'Now, my young friends, what can I do for you?', he asks. The air
is still and musty. Dust motes drift in the stale air.

west.description: There is a door, reinforced with steel, in that direction.

12050.name: The Courtroom
12050.description:
The area opens inside of a large courtroom in which common civil
disputes and criminal matters are decided. There is a judge's bench and
a witness stand on the far side of the room and a jury's box along side.
The Emperor's seal is prominently displayed on the wall behind the
judge's stand, reminding all who enter that he is an extension of his
highness. There is a door, possibly leading to the judge's chambers, to
the east and the waiting room is to the west. Dust motes drift in the
stale air. The ceiling hangs low overhead.

east.description: The door might lead into the judge's private chambers.

south.description: The holding cells lie in that direction.

west.description: The waiting room lies in that direction.

12051.name: The East Gate Of Rome
12051.description:
This isside of the eastern gate of Rome. There are two tall spires built
into the city wall, from which the guards can see the whole eastern side
of the city. The gate is currently open and to the east, there is a
heavily used road, made of packed clay, that leads out of Rome. Another
road leads westward into the city. The cobblestones are worn smooth by
countless feet. The smell of smoke and humanity hangs in the air.

east.description: The clay road heads eastwards.

west.description: The clay street leads into the city.

12052.name: A Mountain Path
12052.description:
The area opens on a small trail that leads up and down. It has recently
been raining and there are small puddles everywhere. The area is just
below the clouds and the view of the surrounding countryside is
breathtaking. The path is steep and treacherous. Bare rock dominates the
landscape.

up.description: The trail leads up and enters the clouds.

12055.name: The Judge's Chambers
12055.description:
This is a small room that is filled with legal tombs. There is a small
desk here, literally buried under legal documents. There is also a small
window overlooking the northern part of the city. The walls are rough-
hewn and cold to the touch. Dust motes drift in the stale air.

west.description: The courtroom lies in that direction.

12056.name: A Mountain Path
12056.description:
This area is a small trail that leads through a grove of trees. Every
thing is lush and green here and it appears to have been raining
recently. 'This would be an ideal place for a picnic.' , you think to
yourself. The path is steep and treacherous. Bare rock dominates the
landscape.

up.description: You see a small trail leading further up the mountain.

down.description: You see a small trail, leading down.

12058.name: The Valley Of The Gods
12058.description:
The area opens in a tranquil valley at the base of a large mountain. A
quiet stream, with fruit trees growing along its banks, winds its way
peacefully through the valley and enters a large stone structure that
lies to the west. There are birds singing and every now and then a
ripple breaks the surface of the stream. Visible is a path leading
through the trees to the up. Sheep trails wind between the hillocks. The
wind carries the scent of wild herbs.

north.description: A small path winds its way through the trees.

up.description: You see a path leading up the mountain.

12059.name: A Mountain Path
12059.description:
This area is a path that leads up through a stand of large trees.
Everything is green and it seems like eternal spring - this is Mother
Nature at her finest. It is possible to descend into a tranquil valley
from here. The wind howls around exposed peaks. Snow clings to shadowed
crevices.

up.description: The path leads further up the mountain.

down.description: The path widens out into a tranquil valley.

12060.name: The Holding Cells
12060.description:
This is the holding cell area, just off of the cortroom. Those who are
recently convicted of serious crimes are brought here, pending torture
and execution. The courtroom lies to the north and another exit goes
east. Dust motes drift in the stale air. The air is still and musty.

north.description: The courtroom lies to the north.

12061.name: The Torture Chamber
12061.description:
This is a very small room in which there are many tools designed
specifically for inflicting pain and suffering. Some of them are
familiar, such as the rack and the iron maidens. Others, you have never
seen before and they make you wonder about the kind of sadistic mind
that dreamt them up. The only exit is to the west. The air is still and
musty. The ceiling hangs low overhead.

west.description: The holding cells lie in that direction.

12062.name: The Roman Bakery
12062.description:
This is the bakery of Rome and your mouth waters at the delicious aromas
wafting from the kitchen. The only exit is to the east. The walls are
rough-hewn and cold to the touch. The air is still and musty.

12063.name: The General Store
12063.description:
This is the only general store of Rome. The walls and shelves are
covered with all of the various items required by Roman citizens and
stalwart adventurers. Clay Avenue lies to the south. The ceiling hangs
low overhead. The air is still and musty.

south.description: Clay Avenue lies in that direction.

12064.name: Before Rome
12064.description:
You travel upon an East-West road wide enough for 30 men to march
abreast. It is packed hard through heavy use. To the west stands the
Gates of Rome inviting you to enter and partake of all the glory and
splendor that is Rome. The smell of smoke and humanity hangs in the air.
Buildings crowd together on all sides.

12065.name: Clay Road
12065.description:
You travel upon an East-West road wide enough for 30 men to march
abreast. It is packed hard through heavy use. To the west, your eyes
catch the splendors of a mighty city. Buildings crowd together on all
sides. The sounds of city life echo around.

12066.name: Clay Road
12066.description:
You travel upon an East-West road wide enough for 30 men to march
abreast. The smell of smoke and humanity hangs in the air. The
cobblestones are worn smooth by countless feet.

12067.name: The End Of The Clay Road
12067.description:
The mighty clay road turns into lesser, but still well traveled roads
here. You feel a surge run through your body as you look East into the
lands that Rome turned into its mighty empire. The smell of smoke and
humanity hangs in the air. Vendors and pedestrians bustle past.

east.description: A dirt trail leads towards the desert to the east.

west.description: The mighty clay road leads off in this direction.

12068.name: A Small Dirt Trail
12068.description:
This small dirt path seems to be a joint between a large clay road
located a short distance to the west and the expanse of sand which opens
up before to the east. The clay road appears to lead through the
foothills towards the snowcapped mountain chain to the west. Perhaps
there is a city or settlement in that direction. You cannot see any
breaks in the horizon of the sand which fills your vision as you look to
the east, it seems to stretch forever. The sounds of city life echo
around. The cobblestones are worn smooth by countless feet.

east.description: The expanse of the Great Eastern Desert opens up before you.

west.description: A large clay road begins a short distance to the west.

12000.name: The Coliseum Gates
12000.description: Massive stone gates mark the entrance to the great Roman Coliseum. The roar of crowds can be heard from within, and the smell of sand and sweat fills the air.

12011.name: The Eastern Coliseum Corridor
12011.description: A wide corridor runs along the eastern side of the Coliseum. Stone arches frame views of the arena below, where combatants test their mettle.

12041.name: Clay Avenue South
12041.description: Clay Avenue continues southward here, the packed earth road lined with modest dwellings. Terracotta pots of herbs sit outside doorways.

12057.name: The Valley Approach
12057.description: The path winds northward toward the Valley of the Gods. Massive stone pillars, remnants of an ancient temple, line the way.

12000.name: judge
12000.long_desc: An adjudicator is watching the games intently.
12000.description:
The adjudicator is a retired gladiator and scars cover all exposed parts of
his body.  Although he is getting on in years, he remains healthy and fit.

12001.name: scorekeeper
12001.long_desc: A scorekeeper has one eye on his stopwatch and the other on a clipboard.
12001.description:
The scorekeeper is a young man of about 25 years of age and is very intently
studying his clipboard.

12003.name: spectator
12003.long_desc: A spectator is here watching the games.
12003.description: The spectator is filthy, half drunk and screaming his head off.

12004.name: noble
12004.long_desc: A nobleman stands here looking aloof.
12004.description:
The nobleman is dressed in fine clothes and jewelry and has a very snobbish
attitude.  While he is getting old and his hair and beard are streaked with
gray, he is by no means an easy target.

12005.name: slave
12005.long_desc: A slave stands here, wishing that she was free.
12005.description:
A very pretty young woman who was captured instead of being killed when
the Roman legions subjugated her land.

12006.name: gladiator
12006.long_desc: There is a gladiator standing here.
12006.description:
A well muscled man who is very heavily armored and armed to the teeth.  He
lives for combat.

12007.name: driver
12007.long_desc: There is a chariot driver here.
12007.description:
You see a very slight and small individual whose whole life is centered around
nothing but horses and speed.

12008.name: coach
12008.long_desc: There is a coach standing here, going over last minute strategy.
12008.description:
As you try to look over his shoulder and listen in on his mumbling,
he looks up at you and gives you a glare that chills you to the
bone.

12009.name: healer
12009.description:
You see a young man, still learning about magical healing, wearing a white 
coat and using a stethoscope.

12010.name: herbalist
12010.long_desc: There is a beautiful young lady here, standing here.
12010.description:
The herbalist is a very beautiful young lady who is about 22 years old.  She 
has deep brown eyes and shoulder-length chestnut hair.  Her body is perfectly 
proportioned and she stands about 5' 5" tall.

12011.name: shopkeeper
12011.long_desc: Titus' shopkeeper is here, minding the store.
12011.description:
The shopkeeper is an older man in his middle to late fifties and looks like
he enjoys the quiet life.  There is a long scar running from the edge of his
mouth to his right ear, making it look like he is always smiling.

12012.name: peddler
12012.long_desc: A poor peddler is standing here, trying to support his meager existence.
12012.description: You see a small, dirty man who doesn't look very healthy.

12013.name: page
12013.long_desc: A page stands here, waiting to run an errand.
12013.description:
You see a young boy who looks very strong and very fast.  He has the look of
a scholar about him.

12014.name: plaintiff
12014.long_desc: The plaintiff stands here, pleading his case.

12015.name: master
12015.long_desc: A ticket master is here, looking at you expectantly.
12015.description:
He seems to be waiting for you to either buy a ticket or to get out
of his way so that he can sell tickets to people that actually want
them.

12016.name: vendor
12016.long_desc: A stadium vendor is walking here, selling overpriced hotdogs and beer.
12016.description:
The vendor is a scruffy looking man who isn't afraid of a fight and looks
like he has had just about enough of smart-mouthed spectators.

12017.name: citizen
12017.long_desc: A citizen of Rome is standing here.
12017.description: It appears to be your ordinary citizen going about his business.

12018.name: gateguard
12018.long_desc: A gateguard stands here, tending the gate.
12018.description: You see a strong, loyal public defender.

12019.name: soldier
12019.long_desc: A soldier on leave is walking around looking for entertainment.
12019.description:
You see a member of one of the Emperor's elite legions.  He looks VERY strong.
You have this vague feeling that his entertainment isn't going to be a very
wholesome activity.

12020.name: emperor
12020.long_desc: Julius Caesar, the Emperor of Rome, is sitting here.
12020.description:
You see a man who is dressed in the finest of clothes, has eaten the best of
foods and lived in the most opulent palace that Rome has ever known.

12021.name: guard
12021.long_desc: There is a royal bodyguard here, ready to die for the Emperor, if necessary.
12021.description:
The bodyguard is dressed in the finest of armor and wields only the
deadliest of weapons.  He is very strong and would put up one hell
of a fight.  He has been trained to be suspicious of all but the
most innocent visitors, and likely to take offense of anyone with
less than pure intentions.

12022.name: judge
12022.long_desc: A judge is standing here, reading a case.
12022.description:
He seems to be quite interested in the case, perhaps you shouldn't
disturb him now, later would probably be a better time.

12023.name: master
12023.long_desc: The master scheduler is here, writing in an appointment book.
12023.description:
As you look at him, he looks up at you and asks, 'Do you have an
appointment?'  He waits for a few seconds and then asks, 'Would
you like one?'

12024.name: slimeball
12024.long_desc: A green ball of slime is hanging over you, oozing downward.
12024.description: There is a green 'ball' of slime oozing from the coating on the walls.

12025.name: froboz
12025.long_desc: Froboz the wizard is standing here, working on a new spell.
12025.description:
You see a middle-aged man whose knowledge of magic, both offensive and 
defensive, is legendary.  He literally glows with a pink aura.

12026.name: titus
12026.long_desc: Titus Andronicus is standing here, polishing a few swords.
12026.description:
As you look at him, he suddenly swings a newly sharpened sword
at you!  Watch out!

12027.name: senator
12027.long_desc: A senator is here, waiting for debate to begin.
12027.description: He seems to be quite bored and is playing with the edge of his toga.

12028.name: bailiff
12028.long_desc: The bailiff stands here, keeping order in the courtroom.
12028.description:
He is a very stern man and insists on absolute quiet in his courtroom
unless the judge has given someone permisson to speak.

12029.name: defendant
12029.long_desc: The defendant stands here, pleading her case.
12029.description: She looks to be well organized and full of confidence.

12030.name: jupiter
12030.long_desc: Jupiter, King of the Gods, is watching over his realm here.
12030.description:
He is the strongest of the Gods, and certainly no easy mark!  His powers
transcend the plane of the physical, and could easily kill an unprepared
mortal.

12031.name: venus
12031.long_desc: Venus, the Goddess of Beauty and Knowledge, is resting here.
12031.description:
Venus is probably one of the most beautiful women you have ever seen
if not THE most beautiful.  She is very powerful and tough under that
outer image of beauty.

12032.name: mars
12032.long_desc: Mars, the God of War and State, is sitting down here.
12032.description:
Mars is a tall God with burning, hateful eyes and a large scowl on
his face.

12033.name: mercury
12033.long_desc: Mercury, the messenger of the Gods, is standing here.
12033.description: Mercury is a handsome, youthful God and wears a large grin on his face.

12034.name: shopkeeper
12034.long_desc: Froboz' shopkeeper is here, minding the store.
12034.description:
The shopkeeper is an older man in his middle to late fifties and looks like
he enjoys the quiet life.  There is a long scar running from the edge of his
mouth to his right ear, making it look like he is always smiling.

12035.name: executioner
12035.long_desc: The executioner stands here, waiting to torture some sorry soul.
12035.description:
You see a burly man who is wearing a black hood that obscures his face.  He
has a very sadistic attitude and clearly loves his work.

12036.name: baker
12036.long_desc: The baker looks at you calmly, wiping flour from his face with one hand.
12036.description:
A fat, nice looking baker.  But you can see that he has many scars on his
body.

12037.name: grocer
12037.long_desc: A grocer stands at the counter, with a slightly impatient look on his face.
12037.description: A tall grocer, who moves two 200 pounds bag of flour around on his shoulders.

12000.name: ring
12000.room_desc: There is a pewter ring lying here.

12001.name: belt
12001.room_desc: There is a bronze belt on the ground here.

12002.name: helmet
12002.room_desc: A Roman combat helmet has been left here.

12003.name: whistle
12003.room_desc: A coach's whistle has been left here.

12004.name: stethoscope
12004.room_desc: There is an odd object laying on the ground here.

12005.name: hairpin
12005.room_desc: A woman's hairpin is lying here.

12006.name: apple
12006.room_desc: A delicious looking apple has been left here.

12007.name: orange
12007.room_desc: A sun-ripened orange has been left here.

12008.name: sandals
12008.room_desc: A pair of leather sandals has been dropped here.

12010.name: hotdog
12010.room_desc: A hotdog loaded with chili and onions has been left here.

12011.name: bracelet
12011.room_desc: A bracelet, made from silver and gold, has been carelessly left here.

12012.name: ring
12012.room_desc: A sapphire ring has been left here.

12013.name: pendant
12013.room_desc: A beautiful jade pendant has been left here.

12014.name: robe
12014.room_desc: Froboz' robe has been dropped here.

12015.name: sword
12015.room_desc: A nasty looking tempered sword is lying here.

12016.name: sword
12016.room_desc: A very bloody, but quenched, sword has been left here.

12017.name: bracers
12017.room_desc: A pair of Moorish bracers has been dropped here.

12018.name: plate
12018.room_desc: A piece of military combat plate has been left here.

12019.name: boots
12019.short_desc: a pair of Roman combat boots
12019.room_desc: A pair of combat boots have been left here.

12020.name: thunderbolt
12020.room_desc: Jupiter's Thunderbolt has been left here.

12021.name: loincloth
12021.room_desc: Mars' red loincloth is resting here.

12022.name: necklace
12022.room_desc: Someone has left the crystal necklace of knowledge here.

12023.name: sandals
12023.room_desc: Mercury's winged sandals have been left here.

12024.name: scroll
12024.room_desc: A scroll has been carelessly left here.

12025.name: scroll
12025.room_desc: An ornate scroll has been left here.

12026.name: scroll
12026.room_desc: A plain scroll is lying on the ground.

12027.name: bag
12027.room_desc: There is a small, sweet-smelling bag here on the ground.

12028.name: staff
12028.room_desc: A Kodarta staff has been carelessly left here.

12029.name: wand
12029.room_desc: There is a prototype of a new magical wand lying here.

12030.name: flask
12030.room_desc: There is a flask, containing a blaze orange potion, resting here.

12031.name: mace
12031.room_desc: An executioner's mace is lying here.

12032.name: mug
12032.room_desc: A frosty mug has been left on the ground here.

12033.name: key
12033.room_desc: There is a rusted key here.

12034.name: key
12034.room_desc: A double sided key has been left here.

12035.name: key
12035.room_desc: A diamond studded key is sitting on the ground.

12036.name: key
12036.short_desc: a key with a pearl handle
12036.room_desc: A key with a pearl handle is sitting on the ground.

12037.name: key
12037.room_desc: There is an aquamarine colored key here.

12038.name: key
12038.room_desc: An opal key has been left here.

12039.name: key
12039.room_desc: A steel key is lying on the ground.
